text: hello Team

we are keep on getting these msg in our daemon.log file and because of this the space is getting filled pretty quickly

Jul 25 13:44:06 labs-provision dr-provision[1779]: dr-provision2018/07/25 13:44:06.012853 [926:310]dhcp [ warn]: /home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/digita
Jul 25 13:44:06 labs-provision dr-provision[1779]: [926:310]xid 0xc6bc6039: Ignoring request for DHCP server 10.11.10.19
*our DRP server doesn't act as a dhcp, we have separate dhcp server that is 10.11.10.19"*

how we can get rid of these msgs ?
Any help is appreciated .. Please
<@U9FDQCT5G> - can you please provide the `dr-provision` startup options you are using ?
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/dr-provision --tls-key=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.key --tls-cert=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.pem --static-ip=10.11.110.50
In Info & Preferences, change DHCP Logs from Warn to Error.
then save the changes

<@U9FDQCT5G> also - if you are NOT using DHCP from DRP - then you should / could disable the DHCP service completely which will turn off logging related events from the DHCP subsystem - add `--disable-dhcp` to your `ExecStart` line.
What version of DRP are you running?  The `--static-ip` flag should not be necessary with newer versions.
Guys looks like DHCP is enabled .. and we are not using that at all
so need to disable it
`drpcli --disable-dhcp` should do the work ??
Like <@U6QFVRJNB> said above -^ - add to your systemd execStart line or your command line when you run `dr-provision`

It doesn't stop those msgs ..M I doing it right here

[Service]
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/dr-provision --tls-key=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.key --tls-cert=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.pem --static-ip=10.11.110.50 --disable-dhcp
reloaded the daemon , started the service but the logs dons't stop :slightly_smiling_face:
`ps auxww | grep dr-provision` to see what is running.

$ ps auxww | grep dr-provision
root      2207 16.5  2.1 384432 87732 ?        Ssl  15:31   0:00 /usr/local/bin/dr-provision --tls-key=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.key --tls-cert=/etc/ssl/dr-provision.pem --static-ip=10.11.110.50 --disable-dhcp
`drpcli info status`
now its disabled
You shouldnâ€™t see it in the logs anymore.
yeah
it worked
awesome .. thanks guys for your prompt responses .. love this community .. thanks again

Question for community <!here> using the Terraform Provider....

We've been asked by Hashicorp to make a change to the plan syntax to use snakeCase for DRP Fields inside resource blocks (right now they follow the API capitalization).  We'd likely prefix the fields with "drp" to comply.  For example, "Name" becomes "drpName" in the resource blocks.  The resources may also need to adjust to be drpMachine from drp_machine. 

I'm trying to get a feeling for:
1) if this change will impact your existing plans? how much effort will it be to update?
2) do you have an opinion about this change?  does it help usability?

Thanks.

Hi All!
Can someone provide me with some license info? In particular what are the licensing requirements for access to the deploy-image workflow? And how do you define node? This will be for a very small installation - essentially a small lab/office environment. Thx!
Happy to set you up - started a 1x1 thread for you.  there are some videos about setup.  typically, we offer training since it requires learning how to build images for the process.
Can we transfer or have the same copies of machines data on 2 dr-provision servers if yes then how to copy it from one to another?

<@U9FDQCT5G> at the moment, you have to do this yourself.  It wouldn't be too hard to whip up some scripting around drpcli, or use your favorite toolbox and the API ... but basically you need to export the Machine Object then create the machine object on the other DRP instance.  NOTE - this does not keep the params/profiles/task states/etc. in sync
we are working on a roadmap item for DRP-to-DRP synchronization - but this will be a commercial/enterprise feature
ok.
ok - just tested it - and it works fine

I simply did:
# create a JSON blob of the machine we want to migrate ("test-machine") from "DRP-A"
`drpcli -E <https://drp-a:8092> machines show Name:test-machine > test-machine.json`
# maybe fix the Workflows and Stages setting to be empty
`drpcli -E <https://drp-b:8092> machines create ./test-machine.json`

note - if you have a Workflow/Stage set on the machine - those must exist on your target DRP instance (eg "drp-b").  If they do not, then you can "clear-item" on the workflow prior to exporting the Machine Object, or you can simply modify the JSON inline with `jq` to remove those values, or manually edit them to be empty strings.

there may be other things that fail validation checks that exist in your environment that aren't in my test one - so if you get a Validation failure - pay attention to the error message on why - and fix the JSON related to that Key
<@U9FDQCT5G> - why?
I was able to reboot the machine after transfer, and perform a test workflow on it without any problems
...and yes... I'm curious "why?", too :slightly_smiling_face:
why -> in order to configure a new provisioning server while retaining the old data ..

<@U9FDQCT5G> that works for the machines.  there are other ways (bundles) if you want to transfer configuration / workflows / etc so that you are using source control as source of truth instead of cloning custom DRP configurations
Hi, I am trying to install esxi 6.5, and ran into a problem with the kickstart file esxi-install.ks.tmpl
esxi stops due to an error parsing %pre section

import sys,re,os,urllib,urllib2,base64,syslog,socket, string, ssl, time
url = '{{.ApiURL}}/api/v3/machines/{{.Machine.UUID}}'

class FakeMgr(urllib2.HTTPPasswordMgr):
    def find_user_password(foo, bar, baz):
        return "rs", "rs1"
opener = urllib2.build_opener(urllib2.HTTPDigestAuthHandler(FakeMgr()), urllib2.HTTPSHandler(context=ssl.SSLContext(ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv23)))
req = urllib2.Request(url, data='{"BootEnv": "local"}')
req.add_header('Content-Type', 'application/json')
req.get_method = lambda: 'PUT'

r = opener.open(req)
the error is reported to be on the last line of code : r = opener.open(req)
when I remove the %pre section, the installation runs successfully to completion
however, without the %pre section, the workflow stuck in the install stage and never marked as complete, so every time it reboots, it will start the setup all over again
What version of os-other are you using? <@UBBSHF675> - <@U02DJQSG8> made some change that are in tip, I think.
I believe tip content has his fixes for some of these issues.
how do I get the fixes?
In the UX, under content packages, you can select the upgrade version to be tip.  You should see some thing 1.9 -> 1.9  you can change one of those to tip and upgrade.
got, it looks like the installation is going smoothly.
Thank you.
is there a way to be selective with which machines terraform select to run a workflow ?
filter in the plan.
you mean in terraform plan?
yes - there is a filter struct that is key value pairs that let you filter on parameters.
there was a bug in the provider that was just fixed, make sure you have the latest version!
<@UBBSHF675> ^^
the update includes the ability to create terraform/pools.  I've tried to keep the docs updated
so make sure you have the tip task-library too
